a.style: font-family:'Playfair Display', Georgia, 'Times New Roman', 'Liberation Serif', serif

text.tspan: The CPI shows the average price level of goods and services purchased by consumers. This is expressed
relative to a base year – in this case 2010. For example, a CPI of 120 means that prices were 20% higher than
Data source: International Monetary Fund, via World Bank (2025)
